translation: By the dawn,
and the ten nights[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the first ten nights of the lunar month of Dhul-Hijjah.

translation: and the even and the odd[2],
and by the night when it comes,

arabic_text: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ
translation: are these oaths not sufficient for those who have sense?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād
of Iram[3], who were people of great stature,
footnotes: [3] Iram: an ancient tribe; or a well-known tribe in Yemen; or the grandfather of the people of ‘Aad, etc. Prophet Hūd was sent to the people of ‘Aad.

arabic_text: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ
translation: the like of whom had never been created in the land;
and Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the Valley;
and the mighty and powerful[4] Pharaoh?
footnotes: [4] Or the owner of the stakes by which he used to torture people.

translation: All of them transgressed in the land,
and spread therein much corruption,
so your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is ever vigilant.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ
translation: As for man, when he is tested by his Lord by honoring him and bestowing blessings upon him, he says, “My Lord has [deservedly] honored me[5]!”
footnotes: [5] Instead of being grateful, he is proud, attributing the favor to his own merit.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ
translation: But when he is tested by restricting his provision, he says, “My Lord has [undeservedly] humiliated me!”
No indeed[6]! You are not kind to the orphan,
footnotes: [6] It is not as you think. Allah puts people to test through prosperity and hardship and rewards their gratitude and patience in the Hereafter.

translation: nor do you urge one another to feed the needy,
and you greedily consume the entire inheritance[7],
and love wealth immensely.

arabic_text: كَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا
translation: No indeed! When the earth is crushed over and over,
and your Lord comes[8] with the angels, rank after rank,

arabic_text: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
translation: and Hell is brought near on that Day – this is when man will understand, but what is the use of that understanding?
He will say, “Would that I had sent forth something for my [eternal] life!”
None can punish as He punishes on that Day,
and none can bind as He binds.
[It will be said to the believer,] “O the tranquil soul!
Return to your Lord, well pleased and pleasing [to Him].
Join My [righteous] slaves,
and enter My Paradise.”
